byline.contributor: Taha Siddiqui reported from Kohat, and Declan Walsh from London. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and an employee of The New York Times contributed from Pakistan.
byline.original: By TAHA SIDDIQUI and DECLAN WALSH

abstract: Former detainees and human rights monitors assert dozens of detainees have died in Pakistani military jails in past year and a half, citing instances of torture, starvation and execution; military has escalated its war against Pakistan Taliban by moving into their strongholds and detaining hundreds of people.
lead_paragraph: Dozens have died in military detention amid accounts of torture, starvation and extrajudicial execution from ex-captives, relatives and rights monitors.

headline.main: In Pakistan, Detainees Are Vanishing in Covert Jails
headline.print_headline: Torture, Killings and Secrecy at Pakistan’s Jails for Taliban

snippet: Dozens have died in military detention amid accounts of torture, starvation and extrajudicial execution from ex-captives, relatives and rights monitors.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
